title: Custom Print Formatting
description:
Practice using print() function parameters: sep and end.

Create outputs using custom separators and endings:

1. Print three items with ' | ' separator
2. Print countdown (5,4,3,2,1) with '...' between numbers and '!' at end
3. Print a progress bar using multiple print statements (end='')

Expected output:
apple | banana | orange
5...4...3...2...1!
[==========] Done!
starterCode:
# Part 1: Print with pipe separator
# TODO: Print apple, banana, orange with ' | ' separator

# Part 2: Countdown with custom separators
# TODO: Print 5,4,3,2,1 with '...' between and '!' at end

# Part 3: Progress bar
# TODO: Print [==========] Done! using end=''
solution:
# Part 1: Print with pipe separator
print("apple", "banana", "orange", sep=" | ")

# Part 2: Countdown with custom separators
print(5, 4, 3, 2, 1, sep="...", end="!\n")

# Part 3: Progress bar
print("[", end="")
print("=" * 10, end="")
print("]")
print("Done!")
hints: Use sep parameter to change separator: print(a, b, c, sep=' | ')
Use end parameter to change line ending: print(..., end='!')
For progress bar, use end='' to stay on same line
Remember to add \n after the countdown for new line
